intro: Mastichodendron cylindrocarpon, commonly known as the African mastichodendron, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants such as the cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. It produces small, red fruits that contain a single seed, and it is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
